understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is related to setting and getting the stream throughput in megabits per second for streaming file transfers between datacenters.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is directly related to the configuration setting for throttling all streaming file transfers between datacenters. The code allows users to set and get the stream throughput in megabits per second, which can be used to throttle inter-DC stream throughput.

config_description: Throttles all streaming file transfer between the datacenters, this setting allows users to throttle inter dc stream throughput in addition to throttling all network stream traffic as configured with
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'stream_throughput_outbound_megabits_per_sec' is used to set the maximum outbound stream throughput in megabits per second. The code provided includes methods to set and get the value of this configuration, as well as a method to calculate the rate in bytes based on the configured throughput.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever the 'setStreamThroughputMbPerSec' method is called to update the value of the stream throughput. The frequency of triggering depends on how often this method is invoked in the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'stream_throughput_outbound_megabits_per_sec' configuration option is significant as it throttles all streaming file transfer between datacenters. By setting a lower value for this configuration, users can limit the inter-datacenter stream throughput, which can help in managing network traffic and preventing overload on the system.
